block.p: Leah Meredith Clapman, a daughter of Barbara J. Clapman and Peter C. Clapman of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married last evening to Richard David Fisher, a son of Maree and Jaro P. Fisher of Washington. Rabbi Stephen A. Klein officiated at Crabtree's Kittle House, an inn in Chappaqua, N.Y.

Ms. Clapman, 29, will keep her name. She works in Arlington, Va., for ''The NewsHour with Jim Lehrer,'' where she is the managing editor of the Online News Hour, a Web site, and the creator of NewsHour Extra, a current events site for teenagers. She graduated magna cum laude from Princeton University. Her father is the chief counsel for the investment divisions of TIAA-CREF, the teachers' pension fund in Manhattan.

Mr. Fisher, 32, teaches history at the McLean School, a private high school in Potomac, Md. He also plays bass for Sugarland, a jazz band. He graduated cum laude from the State University College at Purchase, N.Y., and received a master's degree in education from Johns Hopkins University. His mother is a travel consultant at Executive Travel Associates, an agency in Washington. His father is the associate director of sales and marketing for the Ritz-Carlton hotel in Pentagon City, Va.
